title: Balance team, how long you guys are going to pretend that Ignite is fine?
body: Because I'm already tired of this Bull. World's patch is out already, there's no excuse now.

replies.body: What kind of question is this and why does it has so many upvotes

Ignite has the same cooldown as Exhaust and Cleanse, while outperforming both of them. It's Grievous Wounds (which is only found on three items) on a stick, in addition to true damage over 5 seconds. It can also proc electrocute, which in my opinion is a very poor design choice.

The only spells that have a lower cooldown than Ignite are Ghost and Barrier. Ghost has no value against Ignite specifically, and Barrier can block two ticks of Ignite's damage if you time it perfectly, but often will block only one.

Heal was nerfed some time ago because it was "too oppressive" out of the botlane, and Teleport was nerfed soon after when botlaners started taking it _over_ Heal. Meanwhile over this period Ignite has had its damage _increased_ to support the assassin meta Riot has been pushing.

It is a powerful spell with very little counterplay. You can't use Heal or potions to stop it, and if you Cleanse the wrong thing you lose the ability to Cleanse the enemy's Ignite (and the damage still accrues, it's only the GW that's gone).

Barrier, which is Ignite's _only_ counter in summoner spells (sorry if you didn't bring a shield champ with you gaiz), can only block 40% of Ignite's damage at most, so if Electrocute pops your shield while you're still in kill range, you're screwed.

While I agree ignite is over tuned and with most of what you said, you need to be careful about your barrier vs ignite argument. Technically barrier doesn't just block ignite. You can't compare barrier vs ignite simply on the basis of how many ticks it blocks. Barrier can still block a ton of damage, so even if it only blocks a little of ignite, it blocks a flat amount of other damage as well in a given timeframe, and so its net effect is unimpeded. Barrier is still a fine choice against ignite because it will potentially block enough damage to prevent a death.

Heal actually negates more damage than Barrier vs Ignite, despite the GW.

[Actually, Heal heals for 110 less than the amount Barrier shields for.](http://leagueoflegends.wikia.com/wiki/Summoner_spell)

Heal gives 345 in the lategame, Barrier gives 455. In addition, at level 1 Heal heals for 90, and Barrier shields for 115. So the midlaner taking Barrier against the botlaner taking Heal (which the midlaner also has level advantage for scaling) will block more damage from Ignite.

Taking the scaling amount into account, Heal actually gets _less_ value than Barrier over the course of the game, initially being 78% as effective as Barrier, and scaling down to _75%_ by the end of the game.

With the added Grievous Wounds, max level Heal only heals for 246 against Ignite's 505, and level 1 Heal heals for a piddly 64 health against Ignite's 80. And on _top_ of that, Ignite's cooldown is 30 seconds lower than Heal's, and that's not counting additional cdr with Lucidity boots and Cosmic Insight.

Barrier doesn’t last Ignite’s full duration. Redo your math with this in mind then check back. There’s actually already been research done on this and posted on the wiki.

Essentially, cut the Barrier value in half and that’s the actual amount blocked.

Congratulations, you know how to apply concepts in a vacuum! But alas, in a real game there is no such thing as perfect conditions. Good try though!

In most games there are other damage sources in addition to Ignite (such as the famous Electrocute most assassins take in the midlane) that will immediately undo Heal _and still kill the player anyway._ 

It doesn't matter if Heal _theoretically_ is more effective than Barrier, because _in practice_ it is not. You can use Heal against Ignite all of _once_ during the laning phase, because Ignite is up 30 seconds sooner than it. If you survive the level 3 all-in, you will die when the opponent hits 6. And will Heal save you when they buy Draktharr or Luden's and chunk you for 30% health per ability cast? Doubtful.

If you can't 1-shot people you are useless, because with the game being so short right now there is no time to make careful picks on the enemy team, and everyone having so much mobility and cc you can't kill even the squishy targets without a lot of frontloaded damage.
